name: Grilled Sirloin with Chimichurri, Charred Green Beans & Brown Basmati Side Salad
description: Quick braai-seared sirloin served with chimichurri, charred green beans, brown basmati rice, and a fresh mixed-greens salad. Mild, family-friendly and done in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse brown basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Trim green beans and pat dry.
Pat sirloin steak dry; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
Place mixed greens in a salad bowl.
cook_steps: Stovetop: Add brown basmati rice to a pot with 2 parts water and a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low until tender (about 15–20 minutes). Fluff and keep warm.
OutdoorGrill: Lightly oil grates. Toss green beans with a little olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Grill the sirloin steak 3–5 minutes per side for medium (adjust to preference). Transfer to a board and rest 5 minutes.
Grill green beans in a grill basket or on foil until lightly charred and crisp-tender, 4–6 minutes, turning once.
Dress the mixed greens with vinaigrette and toss.
Slice the rested sirloin against the grain. Serve with chimichurri spooned over, a squeeze of lemon, charred green beans, and brown basmati rice on the side.
